data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To move forward you want to take 10 steps forward. To move backward you want to take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around and turning right are same actions. The following is not a possible sequence of actions. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first step is return to the starting point from where you started. The second step is the same as the first step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The previous instructions were: Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Get in sequence. Turn left. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn left at the beginning point. Turn left at the start of step ten. Turn left at the end of step 9. Turn left at the beginning of step ten. Turn around at the end of step three. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around means you start in the beginning and then complete 7 steps. The setting point is a turning left that turns around to the right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 9 steps you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If one takes 6 steps starting from the same location, they take 6 steps back to the starting point. If one takes 8 steps starting from the same location, they take 8 steps back to then at the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing forward has a tendency to take more steps than someone facing backward. One of the ways that one can take more steps more often is to use the "Take 4 steps forward." and the other way is to use the "Take 6 steps forward." suggestions. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 2 steps. You take 2 steps before you turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. When you take step backward, you always take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you take the 6 steps backward and the 8 steps right, taking 6 left. If you always face forward, you take the 6 steps backward and the 8 steps right, taking 1 right. The only positive steps you can take are the 5 steps left and the 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. If we keep facing forward after we've taken 9 steps, we go back to the beginning point. The answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is a simple set of motions. It is not a very challenging setup. If you are facing forward then you can move forward. Moving forward means avoiding left angles. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person usually doesn’ t face backward if they are facing forward. In order to take a step forward, one must take 2 steps. When facing forward, one must take 3 steps right to keep one forward. If one takes 3 steps right to start a new direction, one’ s direction must be the direction you started in. If one turns from one direction to the other, one cannot make a step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn around right and turn around left. Turning to the right requires 4 steps. The answer is No.

In one word, no. If you only take 6 steps, you’re done. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and turn right in 7 step instructions. To turn right in 9 step instructions. To turn right in 7 step instructions. So, the answer is No.

The starting point is at E2. Turn around and take 7 steps to return to the starting point at E2. Thus, the answer is Yes.

To take 1 step back, you need to step back an additional 7 steps. To return to the starting point, you need to step back 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you take 5 steps back, you would take 10 steps back since you are already 5 steps away. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

For every move from the starting point forward, you take 2 steps. Whenever you travel upwards, you take 5 steps. For every movement backwards, you take 5 steps. Going forward, you take 7 steps, staying forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 6 steps down. Take 3 steps right. Take 2 steps to the right. So, the answer is No.

Turn around. Take 4 steps. If you turn around to the right position and then back to the left position, you will back to the starting location. So, the answer is yes.

You will always face forward and only take 6 steps left and 6 steps to the right. So, the answer is yes.

Turning right leads to the starting point. There are two opposite directions you turn around. The starting point is on the opposite side of the road from where you turn right. So, the answer is no.

The first steps backward are always to the left. If you have the second step backward you are facing forward. The third steps backward are from the left. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step and then you will be back to the starting point in 1 step. Take 4 steps and then you will be back to the starting point in 4 steps. So, the answer is No.

Turning around and walking back nine steps is a way to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point is facing down. Facing forward will always lead to you going backward. So, the answer is No.

Take one step backward with your body as straight as possible. Make your step backward as per any instructions you might have. The number of steps you take while facing forward increases from 2 to 5. So, the answer is No.

To do a trick like this you always always face forward and take 5 steps left. The first time you face left, you take 5 steps left and then take 1 step backward. A trick like this would give you a twist in your head and make you jump but actually would turn you into a cat. So, the answer is No.

The instruction says to always face forward but never backward. It does not say to take 6 steps right and 4 steps right. Thus, the answer is no.

You can take 4 steps left and take 5 steps backward. You cannot take 2 steps forward and take 5 steps backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps backward. Take 8 steps backward. Take 10 steps forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

On one of the steps backward, take 1 step forward because you are going right. The second step forward gives you 10 steps to your left. Again, on the other step backward, use 10 steps to your right. So, the answer is No.

One must always be facing forward to ever take backwards steps. If you always face forward, every time you get a chance, you have one more chance to make it. So, the answer is yes.
